perturbation.original_text: Agreement, made as of this day of , 20 between Nationwide Fund Management LLC ("Nationwide"), on behalf of Nationwide Mutual Funds or its surviving entity ("the Trust"), and American United Life Insurance Company, and OneAmerica Securities, Inc., a registered Broker Dealer (collectively referred to as "Servicing Agent," "you" or "your"), whereby you agree to provide certain administrative support services to your customers who may from time to time be the record or beneficial owners of shares (such shares referred to herein as the "Shares") of the funds listed in Appendix A (each a "Fund") subject to the following terms and conditions:
perturbation.changed_text: Agreement, made as of this day of , 20 between Nationwide Fund Management LLC ("Nationwide"), on behalf of Nationwide Mutual Funds or its surviving entity ("the Trust"), and American United Life Insurance Company, and OneAmerica Securities, Inc., a registered Broker Dealer (collectively referred to as "Servicing Agent," "you" or "your"), whereby you agree to provide certain administrative support services to your clientele who may from time to time be the record or beneficial owners of shares (such shares referred to herein as the "Shares") of the funds listed in Appendix A (each a "Fund") subject to the following terms and conditions:
perturbation.explanation: The term 'customers' is changed to 'clientele', introducing ambiguity as to whether 'customers' and 'clientele' are the same in all contexts throughout the document, potentially affecting obligations regarding customer information and service levels.

perturbation.original_text: 15. Privacy Program Each party to this Agreement agrees to protect Customer Information (defined below) and to comply as may be necessary with requirements of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, the relevant state and federal regulations pursuant thereto, including Regulation S-P, and state privacy laws (all the foregoing referred to as "Privacy Law"). 4 Customer Information means any information contained on an application of a customer ("Customer") of a Fund or other form and all nonpublic personal information about a Customer that a party receives from the other party.
perturbation.changed_text: 15. Privacy Program Each party to this Agreement agrees to protect Confidential Information (defined below) and to comply as may be necessary with requirements of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, the relevant state and federal regulations pursuant thereto, including Regulation S-P, and state privacy laws (all the foregoing referred to as "Privacy Law"). 4 Confidential Information means any information contained on an application of a consumer ("Consumer") of a Fund or other form and all nonpublic personal information about a Consumer that a party receives from the other party.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Customer Information' to 'Confidential Information' and 'customer' to 'consumer' creates an inconsistency. While seemingly synonymous, the contract later refers to 'Customer' and 'Customer Information'. If 'Customer' and 'Consumer' have distinct meanings, the scope of the Privacy Program becomes unclear, creating enforcement uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: You agree to provide the Funds, upon written request, the taxpayer identification number ("TIN"), if known, of any or all Shareholder(s) of an account and the amount, date, name or other identifier of any registered representative(s) associated with the Shareholder(s) or account (if known), and transaction type (purchase, redemption, transfer, or exchange) of every purchase, redemption, transfer, or exchange of Shares held through an account maintained by you during the period covered by the request.
perturbation.changed_text: You agree to provide the Funds, upon written request, the taxpayer identification number ("TIN"), if known, of any or all Investor(s) of an account and the amount, date, name or other identifier of any registered representative(s) associated with the Investor(s) or account (if known), and transaction type (purchase, redemption, transfer, or exchange) of every purchase, redemption, transfer, or exchange of Shares held through an account maintained by you during the period covered by the request.
perturbation.explanation: Substituting 'Shareholder(s)' with 'Investor(s)' introduces a subtle but critical ambiguity. While generally referring to the same concept, 'Shareholder' has a precise legal meaning related to ownership, while 'Investor' is more general. This could lead to disputes regarding the scope of information to be provided, particularly if some investors are not technically shareholders. Later references to 'Shareholder' add to the confusion.
